reviews.name: ZeroWater 23-Cup Dispenser with Free TDS Meter  ZD-018
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful product. Switched from Brita to Zero and noticed a huge and better difference in taste. With Zero the water you drink has really no taste so it is easy to drink. This one I never take out of the fridge not even to fill it. It comes with an easy to open flip top lid so you can add water without even taking it out of the fridge. Plus it is really nice because it tells you how much stuff you have in the water without worrying about what date to change the filter. Have filled the pitcher at least 10 times now and the first glass is as great as the last one I drank.
reviews.title: Wonderful product. Lives up to expectations.

reviews.name: ZeroWater 23-Cup Dispenser with Free TDS Meter  ZD-018
reviews.reviewText:
The facts:

Paid 39.99 for the ZeroWater 23 cup dispenser.

Tap water reads 361 TDS

After filtering with Zero Water it read 000.

After two weeks (approximately 10 gallons) the ZeroWater filtered water tasted metallic, like chemicals and acidic.

Tested ZeroWater output and it was 009.

At $40 for this unit, it was able to produce 10 Gallons of drinkable water, which works out to be $4 per gallon.

I emailed Zero Water customer service and have not had a response from them in over a week.

---
My Opinion:

The short filter life makes the ZeroWater product cost prohibitive.

I will not recommend this product to anyone.
reviews.title: Cost Prohibitive Due to Short Filter Life

Nice looking and a good size, but poor design on the valve because it leaked all over the counter, floor, etc overnight. The real kick in the posterior is that Walmart doesn't refund the shipping charges even though they don't sell this item in the store so they make $$ every time they send one of these out.
The water testing unit is nice, but what a waste of time and money the purchase was.

reviews.name: ZeroWater 23-Cup Dispenser with Free TDS Meter  ZD-018
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this to be able to replace distilled water. Used the enclosed meter to compare distilled water, tap water, frig filtered water and the water from Zerowater filter....
Cold Tap water in central Fla... 250 ppm, HOT tap water... 350ppm, Ice cold water from frig filter 220ppm, distilled water 0-ppm, and the water from Zerowater filter 0-ppm. Biggest surprises...
1. hot tap has 100ppm more than cold, Frig filter dose essentially nothing and Zerowater filter is equal to distilled but doesn't taste stale like distilled. Time to filter the reservoir is only 15-20 min.
reviews.title: Produces pure water

reviews.name: ZeroWater 23-Cup Dispenser with Free TDS Meter  ZD-018
reviews.reviewText: I love this product! The spout works great and the water comes out really fast (it is not like the pitcher which the spout doesn't work very well on) and it holds a lot of water. I keep it on my counter and use it for cooking. The water tastes really good and you can tell when you need to change the filter because you can taste the difference.
reviews.title: Great product!
